Docs.summary: Associates activities together in a correlation by representing a particular shared or transient context in the workflow.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Windows Workflow Foundation (WF) provides four types of correlation: [Content Based](~/docs/framework/wcf/feature-details/content-based-correlation.md), [Request-Reply](~/docs/framework/wcf/feature-details/request-reply-correlation.md), [Durable Duplex](~/docs/framework/wcf/feature-details/durable-duplex-correlation.md), and [Context Exchange](~/docs/framework/wcf/feature-details/context-exchange-correlation.md). For more information about correlation, see [Correlation Overview](~/docs/framework/wcf/feature-details/correlation-overview.md), the specific correlation types mentioned previously, and the correlation samples located in the [Services [WF Samples]](~/docs/framework/windows-workflow-foundation/samples/services.md) node of the WF samples.
The runtime uses the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Activities.CorrelationInitializer.CorrelationHandle%2A> for correlation if it is present, otherwise the **CorrelatesWith** property of the messaging activity will be used. If both are absent, the ambient handle provided by <xref:System.ServiceModel.Activities.CorrelationScope> or the workflow service is used.
## Examples The following example shows how to set the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Activities.CorrelationHandle> on a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Activities.SendReply> activity.
